author: Legal Correspondent
text:
The Supreme Court on Friday sought a reply from the CBI on the Delhi government's plea to return to them the documents seized during searches at the office of Rajendra Kumar, Principal Secretary of Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, here in December 2015. A Bench of Justices Ranjan Gogoi and P.C. Pant issued notice to the CBI on the AAP government's plea, challenging the Delhi High Court decision allowing the probe agency to retain the documents seized during the raids. The High Court had put on hold the trial court’s direction to hand over the seized documents to the Kejriwal government.

The CBI raided the office of Mr. Kumar and registered a case against him and others alleging “he had abused his official position by favouring a particular firm in the last few years in getting tenders from a Delhi government department.”
title: SC seeks CBI response on Delhi govt.’s plea
